snippet: A Walmart spokesman said on Friday that the company was “unable to agree upon economic terms” to be the anchor store in a new mall being constructed in Brooklyn.
abstract: Walmart will not be a part of Gateway II, mall project being developed in East New York section of Brooklyn by Related Companies; company officials say they were unable to agree on economic terms for the project, but decision to withdraw comes after local unions, some members of the City Council and community groups expressed alarm at the idea that the big-box retailer might gain a foothold in the city.
lead_paragraph: A Walmart spokesman said on Friday that the company was “unable to agree upon economic terms” to be the anchor store in a new mall being constructed in Brooklyn.

headline.seo: Walmart Opts Out of City Mall After Facing Labor Opposition
headline.main: Walmart Opts Out of New York Mall After Facing Labor Opposition
headline.print_headline: Walmart Opts Out of City Mall After Facing Labor Opposition

keywords.value: United Food and Commercial Workers Union
keywords.name: organizations
